comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Possibly Major General Henry Alexander Greene Sr as described at freepages.genealogy.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~greenefamily/g... Biographical notes on the page include: 3. In 1910, Colonel Henry A. Greene was stationed at Fort Benjamin Harrison (he would later return to Fort Ben as commondant). 4. In 1917, Major General Henry A. Greene became the first commander of Camp Lewis in Washington, the largest military post in the USA at the time. It was named in honor of Captain Merriwether Lewis, Commander of the Lewis and Clark Expedition. Camp Lewis was the first National Army cantonment for draftee training to be opened. The first recruits arrived at Camp Lewis on 5 September 1917 and 37,000 officers, cadre, garrison, and trainees were on post by 31 December.
